bands.name: Structural Anchors
bands.description: Load-bearing primitives. Establish the deterministic frame before generation.

tokens.label: Foundation Layer
tokens.description: The immutable base from which all structure grows.
tokens.usageHint: Use when grounding divergent thinking into stable substrate.

tokens.label: Load-Bearing Node
tokens.description: A point in the system that other elements depend on.
tokens.usageHint: Use to identify critical dependencies before generation.

tokens.label: Boundary Condition
tokens.description: Defines what is inside and outside the solution space.
tokens.usageHint: Use to constrain scope before diverging.

tokens.label: Invariant Core
tokens.description: The property that must remain constant across all transformations.
tokens.usageHint: Use when you need a fixed reference point during exploration.

tokens.label: Scaffold Frame
tokens.description: Temporary structure that enables construction of permanent elements.
tokens.usageHint: Use for intermediate representations that will be discarded.

tokens.label: Phase Gate
tokens.description: A decision point that controls progression between phases.
tokens.usageHint: Use to define the conditions that must be met before advancing.

tokens.label: Constraint Set
tokens.description: The complete set of rules that limit the solution space.
tokens.usageHint: Use to enumerate all hard limits before generating candidates.

tokens.label: Root Node
tokens.description: The originating element of the dependency tree.
tokens.usageHint: Use when tracing causality backward to its source.

tokens.label: Terminal State
tokens.description: The well-defined endpoint of a process.
tokens.usageHint: Use to define done criteria before starting.

tokens.label: Dependency Map
tokens.description: A chart of what requires what before it can exist.
tokens.usageHint: Use to sequence work by dependency order.

bands.name: Quantum Anchors
bands.description: Pre-collapse tokens. Hold superposed states. Prevent premature convergence.

tokens.label: Superposition Hold
tokens.description: Maintains multiple valid states simultaneously before resolution.
tokens.usageHint: Use when avoiding premature convergence on one solution path.

tokens.label: Collapse Vector
tokens.description: The direction in which probability resolves to actuality.
tokens.usageHint: Use to name the axis along which a decision will be made.

tokens.label: Entangled Pair
tokens.description: Two elements whose states are correlated regardless of distance.
tokens.usageHint: Use when two decisions cannot be made independently.

tokens.label: Wave Function
tokens.description: The probability distribution across all possible outcomes.
tokens.usageHint: Use to describe the full possibility space before narrowing.

tokens.label: Observer Effect
tokens.description: The act of measurement that forces resolution of ambiguity.
tokens.usageHint: Use when articulating a question collapses the answer space.

tokens.label: Decoherence Buffer
tokens.description: Protection against premature collapse from environmental noise.
tokens.usageHint: Use to insulate exploratory thinking from external pressure.

tokens.label: Probability Amplitude
tokens.description: The weight of a particular outcome before measurement.
tokens.usageHint: Use to assign relative likelihood to competing candidates.

tokens.label: Interference Pattern
tokens.description: Constructive or destructive overlay of multiple possibility waves.
tokens.usageHint: Use when two ideas reinforce or cancel each other.

tokens.label: Tunneling Path
tokens.description: Passage through a barrier that classical logic forbids.
tokens.usageHint: Use to find non-obvious routes around hard constraints.

tokens.label: Measurement Basis
tokens.description: The chosen frame in which superposition resolves.
tokens.usageHint: Use to define the criteria by which a decision will be evaluated.

bands.name: Pata-Physical Anchors
bands.description: Science of imaginary solutions. Exception logic. Productive paradox.

tokens.label: Exception Driver
tokens.description: The rule derived from the exception, not the norm.
tokens.usageHint: Use to invert standard problem framing via edge cases.

tokens.label: Imaginary Solution
tokens.description: A solution that exists outside ordinary possibility space.
tokens.usageHint: Use to generate candidates that shouldn't work but might.

tokens.label: Clinamen Swerve
tokens.description: The unpredictable deviation that breaks deterministic chains.
tokens.usageHint: Use to introduce controlled chaos into rigid frameworks.

tokens.label: Pataphysical Law
tokens.description: A principle governing the science of imaginary solutions.
tokens.usageHint: Use when the exception becomes the basis for a new rule.

tokens.label: Antinomic Pair
tokens.description: Two contradictory truths that are simultaneously valid.
tokens.usageHint: Use when two incompatible requirements must both be satisfied.

tokens.label: Syzygy Point
tokens.description: The alignment of opposites that produces a third term.
tokens.usageHint: Use to find the synthesis of two extremes.

tokens.label: Absurd Logic
tokens.description: Reasoning internally consistent but built on impossible premises.
tokens.usageHint: Use to explore what would follow if the impossible were true.

tokens.label: Exception Map
tokens.description: The catalogue of all cases that violate the general rule.
tokens.usageHint: Use to enumerate edge cases before designing for the general case.

tokens.label: Equivalent Universe
tokens.description: A parallel solution space where different laws apply.
tokens.usageHint: Use to explore how the problem would be solved under different axioms.

tokens.label: Hallucinatory Anchor
tokens.description: A reference point that is real within its own frame.
tokens.usageHint: Use to treat a speculative future state as if it already exists.

bands.name: Dyadic Anchors
bands.description: Paired tensions. Scaffold between poles. Hebbian co-activation.

tokens.label: Tension Field
tokens.description: The productive space between two opposing forces.
tokens.usageHint: Use when the problem lives between two incompatible extremes.

tokens.label: Mediating Term
tokens.description: The element that bridges two opposing poles.
tokens.usageHint: Use to find the third thing that resolves a binary opposition.

tokens.label: Polarity Axis
tokens.description: The line between two extremes that defines the space.
tokens.usageHint: Use to name the dimension along which tension operates.

tokens.label: Dialectic Loop
tokens.description: Thesis-antithesis-synthesis cycle that generates new understanding.
tokens.usageHint: Use to drive iterative refinement through deliberate opposition.

tokens.label: Resonance Bridge
tokens.description: The connection formed when two systems vibrate at compatible frequencies.
tokens.usageHint: Use when two domains can amplify each other through synchrony.

tokens.label: Opposition Pair
tokens.description: Two elements that define each other through contrast.
tokens.usageHint: Use to clarify a concept by naming its opposite.

tokens.label: Liminal Zone
tokens.description: The threshold space between two states.
tokens.usageHint: Use when the most important action happens at the transition.

tokens.label: Hebbian Link
tokens.description: Connection strengthened by co-activation — what fires together wires together.
tokens.usageHint: Use to track which concepts consistently appear together.

tokens.label: Complementary Split
tokens.description: Separation into parts that together form a complete whole.
tokens.usageHint: Use when a problem is better solved by division than unification.

tokens.label: Dynamic Equilibrium
tokens.description: A balance maintained through continuous mutual adjustment.
tokens.usageHint: Use when stability requires active maintenance, not static lock.

bands.name: Implementation Anchors
bands.description: Crystallization tokens. Ground theory into executable action. Day One Protocol.

tokens.label: Day One Protocol
tokens.description: The minimum viable action that delivers value immediately.
tokens.usageHint: Use when needing immediate utility before the full build exists.

tokens.label: Crystallization Point
tokens.description: The moment when a pattern resolves into concrete form.
tokens.usageHint: Use to mark when an idea is ready to become an artifact.

tokens.label: Execution Vector
tokens.description: The specific direction and force of an implementation action.
tokens.usageHint: Use to express precisely how and where effort will be applied.

tokens.label: Sprint Boundary
tokens.description: The time-boxed container for focused delivery.
tokens.usageHint: Use to define the scope of a single focused work session.

tokens.label: Deployment Gate
tokens.description: The checkpoint that must be cleared before release.
tokens.usageHint: Use to specify conditions that must hold before shipping.

tokens.label: Feedback Loop
tokens.description: The mechanism that routes output back to input for correction.
tokens.usageHint: Use to design systems that improve themselves through use.

tokens.label: Minimal Viable Step
tokens.description: The smallest action that moves the system measurably forward.
tokens.usageHint: Use when paralysis sets in — find the next smallest action.

tokens.label: Integration Point
tokens.description: Where separate components are combined into a working whole.
tokens.usageHint: Use to plan the seams where modules connect.

tokens.label: Graceful Degradation
tokens.description: The ability to reduce functionality without catastrophic failure.
tokens.usageHint: Use to design fallback modes for when resources are constrained.

tokens.label: Constitutional Check
tokens.description: Verification against the fundamental principles of the system.
tokens.usageHint: Use to audit an action against the highest-level goals before committing.
